benchmark_details.name: YinYangAlign
benchmark_details.overview: YinYangAlign is a novel benchmark for evaluating Text-to-Image (T2I) systems across six contradictory alignment objectives, which include balancing adherence to user prompts with artistic freedom and other fundamental tensions in image generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for T2I systems that balances contradictory objectives.

data.source: A combination of diverse datasets including MS COCO, Conceptual Captions, FACTIFY 3M, and others tailored for the contradictory alignment objectives.
data.annotation: Hybrid annotation using Vision-Language Models for automated processes followed by human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on both automated assessments from Vision-Language Models and manual review by human annotators.
methodology.interpretation: High values in various scores indicate strong alignment with the objectives, while lower scores suggest misalignment or insufficient adherence.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed using inter-annotator agreement metrics during the human evaluation process.
